message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about food safety and the precautions that should be taken when handling and consuming meat. To ensure that you do not become ill after eating meat, it is important to cook it thoroughly. Cooking meat at high temperatures kills harmful bacteria and parasites that may be present. Options (A), (B), and (C) are incorrect and can actually increase the risk of illness. Ketchup does not have any significant impact on food safety. Eating raw meat increases the risk of consuming harmful bacteria. Taking meat from a dead raccoon in the road is extremely unhygienic and can lead to food poisoning.

This question requires basic knowledge about food safety and proper cooking techniques. Cooking meat thoroughly is an important step in preventing foodborne illnesses. Option (A) is incorrect because covering meat with ketchup does not guarantee that it will be safe to eat. Option (B) is also incorrect because consuming raw meat increases the risk of foodborne illnesses. Option (C) is not safe because consuming meat from a dead animal on the road can expose you to harmful bacteria. Option (D) is the correct answer because cooking meat to the proper internal temperature kills bacteria and reduces the risk of illness.

This question requires knowledge about food safety practices. To ensure that you will stay free from becoming ill after eating meat, it is important to cook it very thoroughly. Cooking meat at high temperatures kills any harmful bacteria that may be present, reducing the risk of foodborne illnesses. Option (A) of covering it with ketchup is unrelated to food safety. Option (B) of eating it when it's raw can increase the risk of foodborne illnesses as raw meat may contain harmful bacteria. Option (C) of taking the meat from a dead raccoon in the road is highly unsanitary and can lead to various diseases.

This question requires some basic knowledge about food safety and the proper handling and cooking of meat. Option (D) is the correct answer because cooking meat thoroughly helps to kill any bacteria that may be present, reducing the risk of foodborne illnesses. Option (A) is unrelated to food safety. Option (B) is unsafe because consuming raw meat increases the risk of bacterial infections. Option (C) is unsanitary and not a safe practice for handling meat.

Option (A) is incorrect because covering meat with ketchup does not eliminate the risk of illness. Option (B) is incorrect because eating raw or undercooked meat increases the risk of foodborne illness. Option (C) is incorrect because taking meat from a dead raccoon is unsanitary and can lead to illness.
